title: useForm
text: useForm also takes optional arguments. The following example demonstrates all of the arguments with their default values.

children.title: register
children.text: This method allows you to register an input/select Ref and apply validation rules into React Hook Form.

children.title: unregister
children.text: This method allows you to unregister a single input or an array of inputs.

children.title: errors
children.text: Object containing form errors and error messages corresponding to each field.

children.title: watch
children.text: This will watch specified inputs and return their values. It is useful for determining what to render.

children.title: handleSubmit
children.text: This function will pass the form data when form validation is successful and can be invoked remotely as well.

children.title: reset
children.text: This function will reset the fields' values and errors within the form. By supplying omitResetState, you have the freedom to only reset specific parts of the state. You can pass values as an optional argument to reset your form into the assigned default values.

children.title: setError
children.text: The function allows you to manually set one or more errors.

children.title: setValue
children.text: This function allows you to dynamically set the value of a registered field. At the same time, it tries to avoid unnecessary re-rerenders. Only the following conditions will trigger a re-render:

children.title: getValues
children.text: An optimized helper for reading form values. The difference between watch and getValues is that getValues will not trigger re-renders or subscribe to input changes.

children.title: control
children.text: This object is made for React Hook Form's Controller component, which contains methods for registering a controlled component into React Hook Form.

children.title: formState
children.text: This object contains information about the form state.

title: Controller
text: React Hook Form embraces uncontrolled components and native inputs, however it's hard to avoid working with external controlled component such as React-Select, AntD and Material-UI. This wrapper component will make it easier for you to work with them.

title: ErrorMessage
text: A simple component to render associated input's error message.

title: useFormContext
text: Hook function that allows you to access the form context. useFormContext is intended to be used in deeply nested structures, where it would become inconvenient to pass the context as a prop.

title: useWatch
text: Behaves similarly to the watch API, however, this will isolate re-rendering at the component level and potentially result in better performance for your application.

title: useFieldArray
text: A custom hook for working with uncontrolled Field Arrays (dynamic inputs). The motivation behind this hook is to provide better user experience and form performance. You can watch this short video to compare controlled vs uncontrolled Field Array.
